spine_hook: Success = Nov 19–Dec 03 test stores deliver ≥10% incremental footfall, early-window share moves toward 20–30%, event CPA ≤0.8× baseline and QR redemptions ≥5% of entries.

anchors.headline: Current early-window share of season footfall
anchors.expression: Share of total Nov 1–Dec 31 footfall that occurs during Nov 19–Dec 03

anchors.headline: Target foot-traffic uplift in test stores
anchors.expression: Incremental footfall vs matched-control stores during Nov 19–Dec 03

anchors.headline: Event CPA ceiling vs baseline
anchors.expression: Paid-media cost per in-store conversion during event period as a ratio to baseline CPA (October average)

anchors.headline: QR redemption rate as percent of footfall
anchors.expression: Number of event QR redemptions divided by store entries during Nov 19–Dec 03

measurement_plan.expression: Test stores with exclusives/drops vs matched-control stores, normalized for weekday, weather, and baseline trends
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Direct test of whether exclusives drive the 10–15% base uplift without broad price cuts.

measurement_plan.timeframe: Daily measurement; cumulative report on Dec 04
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Shows whether traffic is shifting into the late window to approach the 20–30% goal.

measurement_plan.expression: Paid-media $ allocated to event ÷ attributable in-store conversions during event, divided by baseline CPA (October avg)
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Immediate guardrail on media spend. Pause or reallocate if ratio exceeds 0.8.

measurement_plan.metric: QR redemption rate and buyer-activity share vs promo intensity
measurement_plan.expression: QR redemptions / store entries; buyer activity share = buyers from QR / total buyers; promo intensity = average advertised % discount on featured items
measurement_plan.owner: Head of Retail Operations / Head of Analytics
measurement_plan.timeframe: Measure daily; compare test vs control stores during Nov 19–Dec 03
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Pairs conversion quality to promo depth so we drive buyers not bargain browsers. Use as go/no-go on broader discounting.
